ygData.messageBody:
Just to make it clear, im not taking sides here, just wanted to add
my 2c.

> > Paladins don't have the HP of a warrior, so they
>
> They're not so far behind. I've heard the number 25% less mentioned a
> few times; if true, it's significant, but not massively so. 25% of 100
> is only 25, which isn't very much from a high level mob. 25% of 1000
> is 250, which is a larger number (but still the same fraction); but,
> again, 250 isn't so terribly much when considered against the damage
> output of a high level mob.
>
I think its bigger difference than you think, and as the levels go higher
the divergence is greater, it may start at 25% but it the gap DOES get
bigger. Example compare my level 21 DE Warrior to my friends level 30 WE
ranger;

I have 630hp (aprox) he has aprox 750 (with buff 800 and something). Theres
a 9 Level difference between us and I am not that far behind. This gap just
keeps getting bigger the higher I get.

> Warriors would be better off if bandages weren't so *damn* expensive,
> IMO. Bandages should go for 1sp each; they're just rags that've been
> washed and sterilized in hot water, after all.
>
>
Agreed.


> Examples:
>
> Warriors have to pair with a Cleric (or any mage subclass with healing
> spells, or even a Paladin, who also has healing); because otherwise the
> downtime after fights will catch up with them. Even pairing with other
> Warriors, or with Wizards/Magicians won't work around this; Warriors
> will have to have a healer present to counteract their innate
> disadvantage of requiring healing at the higher levels. SKs are in
> this boat too; they get tricks, but no heals; and so need the healing
> too.
>
This is not the case for me. Since level 12 I have consistently been
pairing with a wizard friend, my down time is nearly non-existent because I
just keep the mobs attention while the wizard blasts. I am his "pet"
effectively :) Warrior and Wizard are a VERY good combo.



> > But to sum up, paladins sacrifice so much melee
> > ability for so little casting ability which
>
> I'm confused where you're getting this 'sacrifice so much melee
> ability' thing from? Paladin combat skills are level with Warriors'.
> The only main difference is at which point a particular skill shows up
> (no kick or dual wield, and everything else 3-5 levels after the
> Warrior receives it), and the lower hps.
>
Paladin combat skills even maxed are 5 points less than a warrior, their not
equal in the martial skills. I dont know how much of a difference 5 points
is, but my 12th level warrior was a MUCH stronger fighter than my 12th level
Paladin. Then again that just maybe my perception (and bias).
